title: Machine Learning for LiDAR-Based Indoor Surface Classification in Intelligent Wireless Environments
authors: Parth Shiroya, Swarnagowri Shashidhar, Amod Ashtekar, Krishna Aindrila Kar, Rafaela Lomboy, Dalton Davis, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: This paper presents a LiDAR-based machine learning framework for classifying indoor surfaces into semi-specular and low-specular types using small 3 cm Ã— 3 cm surface patches. A dataset of 78,000+ LiDAR points from 16 indoor materials was collected, and geometric and intensity-based features were used with Random Forest, XGBoost, and Neural Network classifiers.

title: Refined Bayesian Optimization for Efficient Beam Alignment in Intelligent Indoor Wireless Environments
authors: Parth Shiroya, Amod Ashtekar, Swarnagowri Shashidhar, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A Bayesian optimization framework that accelerates beam alignment in intelligent indoor wireless environments by efficiently reducing the beam search space.

title: From Ghosts to Beams: Radar-Guided LoS/NLoS Beam Alignment for 60 GHz Communications
authors: Aditya Mulik, Daniel R. Popescu, Amod Ashtekar, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A radar-assisted method for distinguishing LoS and NLoS paths and optimizing beam alignment for high-frequency indoor communications.

title: Vision-Based Autonomous mmWave Reflector Using ArUco-Driven Angle-of-Arrival Estimation
authors: Jesus Marroquin, Nwe Inzali, Michael Lantz, Cameron Freeman, Amod Ashtekar, Ameya Mulik, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A mobile mmWave reflector system that uses ArUco-based localization and AoA estimation to autonomously enhance indoor wireless coverage.

title: Compressive Beam Alignment for Indoor Millimeter-Wave Systems
authors: April Junio, Rafaela Lomboy, Raj Sai Sohel Bandari, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A compressive sensing approach to reduce beam training overhead while maintaining alignment accuracy in indoor mmWave environments.

title: LiDAR-Aided Millimeter-Wave Range Extension using a Passive Mirror Reflector
authors: Omar Ibrahim, Raj Sai Sohel Bandari, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A passive reflector system that uses LiDAR intensity patterns to identify optimal reflecting surfaces and extend mmWave coverage in NLoS scenarios.

title: LiDAR-Aided NLoS Path Identification for Enhanced Indoor mmWave Communication
authors: Dalton Davis, Rafaela Lomboy, Long (Sam) Ho, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A LiDAR-based method for identifying viable NLoS reflection paths in mmWave networks to improve connectivity in indoor environments.

title: Detecting Location Spoofing Attacks using Multiple Angle of Signal Arrivals in MM-Wave Vehicular Networks
authors: C. S. Thondebhavi Shanthakumar, A. Chawariya, Y. Cheng, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A multi-AoA detection framework to safeguard mmWave vehicular communication systems from location-spoofing attacks.

title: Millimeter-Wave Antenna Array Diagnosis with Partial Channel State Information
authors: George Medina, Akashdeep Singh Jida, Saran Pulipati, Rohith Talwar, Nancy Amala J, Tareq Y. Al-Naffouri, Arjuna Madanayake, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
abstract: A diagnostic method for mmWave antenna arrays using partial channel state information to detect failures and misalignments.

title: Exploiting Multi-Path for Safeguarding mmWave Communications Against Randomly Located Eavesdroppers
authors: Rohith Talwar, Nancy Amala, George Medina, Akshadeep Singh Jida, Mohammed E. Eltayeb
venue: International Conference on Systems and Networks (ICONS)
abstract: A physical-layer security strategy that uses multi-path diversity to protect mmWave links from randomly positioned eavesdroppers.

title: Xilinx RF-SoC-based Digital Multi-Beam Array Processors for 28/60 GHz Wireless Testbeds
authors: Sravan Pulipati, Viduneth Ariyarathna, Aditya Dhananjay, Mohammed E. Eltayeb, Marco Mezzavilla, Josep M. Jornet, Soumyajit Mandal, Shubhendu Bhardwaj, Arjuna Madanayake
abstract: A digital multi-beam array processor architecture implemented on Xilinx RF-SoC hardware for next-generation 28/60 GHz testbeds.

title: Hybrid Precoding for Channel Estimation in Millimeter Wave Systems with Inter-Cell Interference
authors: Ahmed Mohammed, Mohammed E. Eltayeb, Ivica Kostanic
abstract: A hybrid precoding strategy to perform channel estimation in multi-cell mmWave networks experiencing inter-cell interference.
